page.title: 14A WOOLSTON CHILD'S DAY
page.content:
One Day In My Life by Clare Snow (A Woolston child aged 11)
On Saturday morning I woke at 8am. I dragged myself out of bed and had a quick shower. I took the dog out to the local park. After breakfast I grabbed my coat and purse and went to town with mum and dad. We looked at shops and had a drink at the coffee shop. After buying some cheese at the market we went home. After a rushed dinner I called for a friend and we went to see Mr Fisher who lives at the old persons' home (Woolston Hall). We stayed about an hour then decided to go swimming. We liked the inflatable dragon in the pool! Later I put on my Guide uniform and helped at the old people's party. I got home at 9.20, watched a film then went to bed.
